# Read Emails

Reading Order 
1. train spam (part1-part9)
2. train ham (kitchen-l)
3. test spam (part10-part12)
4. test ham (lokay-m)


```python
train_spam_folders = ["part1", "part2", "part3", "part4", "part5", "part6", "part7", "part8", "part9"]
test_spam_folders = ["part10", "part11", "part12"]

spam_dir = ".\GP"
train_spam_emails = []
train_ham_emails = []
test_spam_emails = []
test_ham_emails = []


# train spam 
for folder in train_spam_folders: 
    for root, dirs, files in os.walk(os.path.join(spam_dir, folder)):
        for name in files:
            file_path = os.path.join(root, name) 
            with open(file_path) as f:
                data = f.read()
            train_spam_emails.append(data)

# train ham 
for root, dirs, files in os.walk(os.path.join(".\kitchen-l")):
    for name in files:
        file_path = os.path.join(root, name) 
        with open(file_path, errors='surrogateescape') as f:
            data = f.read()
        train_ham_emails.append(data)

# test spam 
for folder in test_spam_folders: 
    for root, dirs, files in os.walk(os.path.join(spam_dir, folder)):
        for name in files:
            file_path = os.path.join(root, name) 
            with open(file_path) as f:
                data = f.read()
            test_spam_emails.append(data) 

# test ham 
for root, dirs, files in os.walk(os.path.join(".\lokay-m")):
    for name in files:
        file_path = os.path.join(root, name) 
        with open(file_path, errors='surrogateescape') as f:
            data = f.read()
        test_ham_emails.append(data)
```

     'From: "Dr. Gabriel Uche Bola" <doctor_bolas@hotmail.com>\nTo: <paliourg@cs.man.ac.uk>\nSubject:     My Dearest, Pls read this Dr. Gabriel Uche Bola\nDate: Wed, 21 Jan 2004 09:54:47 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3Dus-ascii">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE>    My Dearest, Pls read this Dr. Gabriel Uche =\nBola</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n<BR>\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>HAVANA SPECIALIST HOSPITAL<BR>\n134B Off Bode Road.<BR>\nSurulere-Lagos. Nigeria.<BR>\nAttention:<BR>\n&nbsp; My Dearest,<BR>\nI have a business proposal, which I know might interest you.<BR>\nMy name is Dr.Gabriel Uche Bola, a medical doctor and<BR>\na worker of the above specialist hospital. I have a widow<BR>\nhere in my clinic who is on a political asylum in Nigeria<BR>\nRefugee Camp, she has been so ill for some couple of months now.<BR>\nThis woman confided in me based on the free medical attention<BR>\nI have been giving to her and her children.She had revealed to me<BR>\nof her life history and about her late husband who was a top =\nmilitary<BR>\nofficer in one of the West African country (Sierra-Leone) before his<BR>\ndeath during the civil war and the fortune she inherited from his =\nlate<BR>\nhusband. She has asked me to source a credible and trustworthy<BR>\npartner abroad who will manage her funds for investment,the sum<BR>\nof Five Million US Dollars (US$5m) which her late husband<BR>\ndeposited in a safe Fiduciary Agent based in Madrid Spain. I wish<BR>\nto choose you for this venture and I believe you will be in the =\nposition<BR>\nto assist in managing and investing this large sum in a profitable =\nventure<BR>\nand also to help create a safe heaven for her and her children by =\nmaking<BR>\na residence arrangement for them in your country. After she had<BR>\ndisclosed this information to me, I saw the reason to request from =\nher<BR>\nto allow me see he documents relating to this deposit of which she =\ndid.<BR>\nI am obliged to assist this lady knowing too well that she has a =\nlimited<BR>\nknowledge in the business world and as such she can not manage this<BR>\nfunds herself and in Africa in order to avoid any trace of her by =\nthe<BR>\ngovernment, I will need from you a mutual understanding and then we<BR>\nshall make plans on how the funds would be secured into an account =\nin<BR>\nyour name; after which you will arrange and travel immediately to =\nmeet<BR>\nwith the security company Agent for clearing. This amount is =\ncontained<BR>\nin a sealed trunk box and it is registered and declared as containing =\nfamily<BR>\ntreasures, so even as I am writing you now the security company Agent =\nis<BR>\nnot aware that there is cash money in the trunk. Let me assure you that =\nthis<BR>\ntransaction is 100% hitch - free and risk - free. From my discussion =\nwith her,<BR>\nshe has agreed to give you a reasonable amount of percentage for =\nyour<BR>\ninvolvement in this and this has to be discussed upon the receipt of =\nyour<BR>\nquick response. Thanks and God bless you for your understanding.<BR>\nSincere regards,<BR>\n&nbsp;Dr. Gabriel Uche Bola<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n</FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',

     'From: "Tukur Mana" <mana2001@hamptonroads.com>\nTo: <paliourg@cs.man.ac.uk>\nSubject:   END OF YEAR VENTURE\nDate: Sat, 10 Jan 2004 07:34:23 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3Dus-ascii">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE>  END OF YEAR VENTURE</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>FROM:TUKUR MANA,<BR>\nFEDERAL SECRETARIAT COMPLEX,<BR>\nIKOYI.<BR>\nEMAIL :t_mana@fsmail.net<BR>\n<BR>\nBest wishes of good health and success in your pursuits particularly =\nthrough my proposal as contained in this letter.Before going<BR>\ninto details of my proposal to you, I must first solicit you to treat =\nthis with utmost confidentiality, as this is required for its<BR>\nsuccess.<BR>\n<BR>\nINTRODUCTION:<BR>\nMy colleagues and I are senior officials of the Federal Government of =\nNigeria? Contracts Review Panel who are interested in<BR>\ninvesting some funds that are presently floating in the accounts of the =\nCentral Bank of Nigeria. In order to commence this<BR>\ntransaction, we solicit your assistance to enable us transfer into your =\naccount the said floating funds.<BR>\n<BR>\nWe are determined to conclude the transfer before the end of this =\nquarter of 2003. The source of the funds are as follows: During<BR>\nthe last military regime,government officials awarded contracts that =\nwere grossly over-invoiced to Contractors.The present civilian<BR>\ngovernment set up the Contract Review Panel, which has the mandate to =\nuse the instruments of payments made available to it by the<BR>\ndecree setting up<BR>\nthe panel, to review these contracts and if necessary pay those who are =\nbeing owed outstanding amounts. My colleagues and I have<BR>\nidentified quite a huge sum of these funds which are presently floating =\nin the Central Bank of Nigeria ready for disbursement and<BR>\nwould like to invest some of it for our own purposes.<BR>\n<BR>\nHowever, by virtue of our positions as civil servants and members of =\nthis panel,we cannot acquire these funds in our names or in the<BR>\nnames of companies that are based in Nigeria. I have therefore been =\nmandated, as a matter of trust by my colleagues in the panel, to<BR>\nlook for a reliable overseas partner into whose account we can transfer =\nthe sum of Sixteen million,five hundred thousand U.S.<BR>\nDollars That is why I am writing you this letter.<BR>\n<BR>\nWe have agreed to share the money to be transferred into your account,if =\nyou agree with our proposition as follows; (i) 10% to the<BR>\naccount owner (you). (ii) 80% for us (the panel officials). (iii) 10% to =\nbe used in settling all expenses (by both you and<BR>\nus )incidental to the actualisation of this project. We wish to invest =\nour share of the proceeds of this project in foreign stock<BR>\nmarkets and other business till we are<BR>\nready and able to have access to them without raising any eyebrows here =\nat home.<BR>\n<BR>\nPlease note that this transaction is 100% safe . We intend to effect the =\ntransfer within fourteen(14) banking days from the date of<BR>\nreceipt of the following information: Your name, company? name, address =\n,telephone and fax numbers . The above information will<BR>\nenable us write letters of claim and job description respectively. This =\nway, we will use your company? name to apply for the<BR>\npayment and backdate the award of the contract to your company. We are =\nlooking forward to carrying out this transaction with you and<BR>\nwe solicit your utmost confidentiality in its execution.<BR>\n<BR>\nPlease acknowledge the receipt of this email by replying urgently. =\nAlso,endeavour to furnish me with your phone number so that I can<BR>\ncall you and bring you into a more detailed picture of this transaction =\nwhen I hear from you.<BR>\n<BR>\nBest regards,<BR>\n<BR>\nDr Tukur Mana.<BR>\n<BR>\nPlease send your replies to me on my alternative mail address =\n:t_mana@fsmail.net<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n</FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',

(SRGE) is a cutting-edge leader<BR>\nthat designs, develops, manufactures, and markets superior<BR>\npatented outside plant electrical surge protection<BR>\nequipment for the telecommunications industry.<BR>\nThe US sales projections for this market are $4 Billion<BR>\nannually, with this figure growing rapidly as the<BR>\nexpansion of new HDSL and ADSL technologies permeate<BR>\nthe industry.<BR>\n<BR>\nSRGE provides the Telecom industry with the highest<BR>\nquality &quot;protection element&quot; for complex digital switches.<BR>\nProtecting these Telecom switching devices is crucial to<BR>\ninclusive components that are sensitive to interruptions<BR>\nin voltage which can cause extensive network damage, thus<BR>\nnegating costly and time-consuming repair and down-time.<BR>\nMajor Telecoms require this protection throughout their<BR>\nnetwork in order to prevent the hazards of harming<BR>\npersonnel, damaging expensive equipment, and massive<BR>\nsystem failures.<BR>\n<BR>\nOpening Price: 1.15<BR>\n10 Day Target: 2.30<BR>\n1 Month Target: 4.50<BR>\nOutstanding Shares: 16.5 million<BR>\nEst. Float: 2.2 million<BR>\n<BR>\nHow many times have you seen issues explode but you<BR>\ncouldn\'t get your hands on them or didn\'t have the right<BR>\ninformation in time? You may have seen it before, maybe not. At any rate it is =\ntruly a program that has the potential to reap large gains with small =\ninvestments. Take time to consider the vast number of people this could =\nreach. Imagine the outcome if everyone does exactly as instructed. Read =\non and take the first steps towards your goal of financial security.<BR>\n<BR>\nMega- millionaire Donald Trump was a guest one evening on a television =\ntalk show when he was asked, &quot; What would you do if you again lost =\nall your money?&quot;<BR>\n<BR>\nTrump didn\'t pause, &quot; I\'d find a good multi-level marketing program =\nand get back to work.&quot;<BR>\n<BR>\nThe audience didn\'t understand his answer... and they also didn\'t like =\nit. They actually BOOED.<BR>\n<BR>\nTrump didn\'t bat an eye. &quot;That is why I\'m sitting up here...and =\nyou\'re sitting out there... just another face in the crowd.&quot;<BR>\n<BR>\nPlease read the following before you delete it... if you\'re busy right =\nnow, put it aside until you have some free time... then read it, and =\nthen read it again.<BR>\n<BR>\nThis e-mail is about a Multi-Level-Marketing (MLM) program that can =\nchange your life. And it\'s so very simple that absolutely anyone can do =\nit.<BR>\n<BR>\nThis e-mail,yes, THIS ONE, can make you a lot of money just like it\'s =\nbeen doing for others all around the world!<BR>\n<BR>\nHere\'s how...<BR>\n<BR>\nFirst, this is a business. As I said, it\'s called Multi-Level Marketing: =\nand it deals with e-Books. An e-Book is a book that can be downloaded, =\nand in this case, information that can be distributed by e-mail.<BR>\n<BR>\nYour product is information. In this case, five e-Books written =\nexplaining in detail &quot;how to&quot; market, advertise and sell on =\nthe Internet. It is a very simple, perfectly legal and a most enjoyable =\nfree enterprise. If you decide to participate, you\'ll have a lot of fun =\nbut even more importantly, you can make a lot of money.<BR>\n<BR>\nAnd you can do it again and again, over and over, as often as you =\nlike!<BR>\n<BR>\nHere\'s how it works and how you can work it.<BR>\n<BR>\nFollow these instructions exactly. Don\'t change anything, other than =\nthose items items you are told to change. This program works excellent =\n&quot;as is&quot; so if you try to improve on it by switching names =\nyou\'ll be out of business before you begin. Also, please do not replace =\nnames of the people who are already on the letter with friends or =\nrelatives. The people who are on the letter have a lot invested and it\'s =\nnot fair to them to give all the money to your family and friends. THIS =\nPROGRAM WORKS. People are making lots of money with this hugely =\nsucessful enterprise.<BR>\n<BR>\nDON\'T MESS WITH SUCESS!!!<BR>\n<BR>\n*** This program works with either U.S. $ 5 Bills or you may substitue $ =\n8 Canadian.***<BR>\n<BR>\nWhen you decide to participate, the first thing you will do is spend $ =\n25.00 of your own money. You take five $ 5 bills, U.S. ( $ 8 =\nCanadian)&nbsp; and you purchase the five seperate &quot;e-books&quot; =\nlisted further along in this e-mail.<BR>\n<BR>\nYou will order these &quot;e-books&quot; by sending $5 ( or $8 Canadian) =\nto each of 5 persons by normal postal routes.<BR>\n<BR>\nThese 5 e-books will be delivered to you via e-mail.<BR>\n<BR>\nScroll down to locate the 5 e-books. For each e-book, write on a sheet =\nof paper the name and number of the e-book that you are requesting, also =\ninclude your e-mail address ( ensure all this is truly legible). Wrap =\nthe $5 bill ( $ 8 Canadian) in this sheet of paper, put it in an =\nenvelope, seal it and address it to the person listed for that =\nparticular e-book. Then quickly drop the 5 envelopes in the nearest =\nmailbox.<BR>\n<BR>\nWhen you have finished ordering the five &quot;e-Books&quot;, and only =\nAFTER those orders are in the mail, return to the list and remove the =\nname and address of the person in e-book # 5. This person has made it =\nthrough the cycle and is no doubt counting their fortune.<BR>\n<BR>\nThen, move the name and address in e-book # 4 down to e-book # 5.<BR>\n<BR>\nNext, move the name and address in e-book # 3 down to e-book # 4.<BR>\n<BR>\nNext, move the name and address in e-book # 2 down to e-book # 3.<BR>\n<BR>\nNext, move the name and address in e-book # 1 down to e-book # 2.<BR>\n<BR>\nThen, insert your name and address in the e-book # 1 position.<BR>\n<BR>\nOnce again save this e-mail, make a backup copy and then go about your =\nnormal business.<BR>\n<BR>\nWithin a few days you will receive the five e-books you ordered via =\ne-mail As promised, you\'ll find each contains valuable information about =\nmarketing on the Internet. Down-to-earth, practical information you\'re =\nabout to use. Save the five e-books on your computer and make a back up =\non a floppy The five e-books are your stock-in-trade and as such are =\nvaluable. You are not only going to benefit from the knowledge they =\ncontain but more to the point, you are going to sell them, over and =\nover. And they can make you quite wealthy.<BR>\n<BR>\nWe\'re talking about a lot of money. Let me give you an example of just =\nhow much money we could be talking about.<BR>\n<BR>\nThere are TWO Primary methods to get this venture underway:<BR>\n<BR>\nMETHOD # 1: SENDING BULK E-MAIL (LEGALLY).<BR>\n<BR>\nLet\'s say that you decide to start small, just to see how it goes. Let\'s =\nassume you will assume you and the others send out only 5,000 copies of =\nthis e-mail each.<BR>\n<BR>\nLet\'s also assume that the mailing receives only a .02% (2/10 of 1%) =\nresponse. The response could be much greater, but let\'s assume a rate of =\n.02%. Some will send larger amounts of e-mail instead of 5,000.<BR>\n<BR>\nNevertheless let\'s continue with this example based on everyone sending =\n5,000 e-mails.<BR>\n<BR>\nNow watch how this works!!!<BR>\n<BR>\nWith a response of .02% you\'ll receive only 10 orders for e-book # 1. =\nThose 10 orders (people) then respond by sending out 5,000 e-mails each =\nfor a total of 50,000.<BR>\n<BR>\nOut of those 50,000 e-mails only .02% respond with orders. That\'s 100 =\npeople who responded and ordered e-book # 2.<BR>\n<BR>\nThose 100 people mailed out 5,000 e-mails each for a total of 500,000 =\ne-mails. A .02% response rate equals 1000 orders for e-book # 3.<BR>\n<BR>\nThose 1000 people send 5,000 e-mails each for a total of 5 million =\ne-mails sent. A .02% response rate equals 10,000 orders for book # =\n4.<BR>\n<BR>\nThose 10,000 people send 5,000 e-mails each for a total of 50 million =\ne-mails. A .02% response rate equals 100,000 orders for e-book # 5.<BR>\n<BR>\nThat\'s 100,000 orders @ $ 5.00 each or $ 500,000.00. (HALF-A-MILLION =\nDOLLARS).<BR>\n<BR>\nSee how it works? No matter how you look at it, if those who participate =\nfollow the simple directions, a lot of people will sell a lot of e-books =\nand make a lot of money.<BR>\n<BR>\nMETHOD # 2: PLACING FREE ADS ON THE INTERNET.<BR>\n<BR>\nAdvertising on the &quot;Net&quot; is very inexpensive as there are =\nhundreds of places that will take your classified ad for FREE.      'From: <DR>\nTo: <paliourg@cs.man.ac.uk>\nSubject:   PLEASE GET BACK  TO  ME.\nDate: Mon, 12 Jan 2004 18:07:40 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3Diso-8859-1">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE>  PLEASE GET BACK  TO  ME.</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>ATTN: FRIEND,<BR>\nI am the chief accountant and the chairman contract Tender Board =\ncommittee(CTBC) of the Petroleum, Oil &amp; Gas Corporation of South =\nAfrica (PTY) Ltd also known as PETROSA. I am presently on a special =\ndiplomatic<BR>\nduty in the South Africa foreign office in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. I =\ngot your contact through discreet inquiries in my search for are liable =\nindividual or company who can handle a strictly confidential involves =\nthe transfer of a reasonable sum of money to a foreign account. I have =\nno doubt in your ability to handle a financial business of considerable =\namount, which will form the bedrock of an extensive business partnership =\nin due course. In unfolding this proposal, I want to count on your =\nstatus that you will handle this transaction with all maturity and =\nconfidentiality it deserves. The money we want to transfer to you amount =\nto a total of US$12.500,000.00 (Twelve Million, Five Hundred Thousand =\nUnited States Dollars) only. It was extracted from various over-invoiced =\ncontracts, masterminded by myself and some of my Colleagues for our =\nmutual benefit when the contracts was awarded by the Contracts Tender =\nBoard committee (CTBC) of the Petroleum, Oil &amp; Gas Corporation of =\nSouth Africa (PTY) Ltd. The above over-invoiced sum has been drafted and =\nshort-listed for final payment to a foreign bank account and it has been =\nreflected as an amount to be paid to a foreign contractor for contract =\nthat has been executed for the Petroleum, Oil &amp; Gas Corporation of =\nSouth Africa (PTY)Ltd. The money is currently floating in the suspense =\naccount of the South Africa Reserve Bank (SARB)awaiting claim by a =\nforeign partner, which status we absolutely want you to assume. The code =\nof conduct bureau in South Africa has made it an offence for civil =\nservants like us to (A) operate a foreign account (B) own a foreign =\ncompany and (C) take up contract while still in active service. This is =\nwhy we need your assistance Now is the optimum period to realize this =\nfund following the recent directive given to all-federal parastatals and =\ncorporations to pay off all foreign debts. I therefore seek your =\nassistance to allow the remittance of this fund to be made to your =\npersonal or company\'s bank account. We have agreed that 20% of the total =\nsum will be given to you,10% for expenses and 70% will be for me and my =\ncolleagues after the successful transference of the fund to your bank =\naccount.I want to assure you that all modalities for the successful =\ntransfer of this money to your account has been perfectly worked out and =\nas such, there is no fear of failure. However, I would want to believe =\nthat you are honest enough misgiving attitude In any aspect of the =\ntransaction. Most Importantly, you will keep this transaction very =\nconfidential so as not to tarnish the confidence reposed on these =\nofficials by the nation\'s financial house. Kindly indicate your =\nwillingness to me through email Address:<BR>\nyankmakabo@netscape.net for immediate commencement of the transaction. =\nTo enable this fund to be successfully transferred to your account, you =\nwill also have to provide the following information: 1.Your name and =\naddress. 2. Your private telephone, fax Numbers.3.Your Bank details =\nwhere you would want the money remitted. More information about the =\nremittance of the fund to your account will be sent to you when I =\nreceive your response.&nbsp; Meanwhile, your swift response will help us =\nto meet the ultimatum given to all foreign contractors in this payment =\nquarter to ensure that funds are claimed. We have the plan of investing =\npart of our fund in real estate with your assistance in your =\ncountry.<BR>\nI await your urgent response.<BR>\nYours faithfully,<BR>\nDR.YANK MAKABO,<BR>\n&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',

     'From: <massaquoi@fsmail.net>\nTo: <paliourg@cs.man.ac.uk>\nSubject:   PRIVATE.\nDate: Tue, 23 Dec 2003 01:48:46 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3Dus-ascii">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE>  PRIVATE.</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>Dear Friend.<BR>\nGood Day, With warm heart I offer my friendship, and greetings, and I =\nhope this mail meets you in good time. However strange or surprising =\nthis contact might seem to you as we have not met personally or had any =\ndealings in the past, I humbly ask that you take due consideration of =\nits importance and immense benefit. I duly apologize for infringing on =\nyour privacy, if this contact is not acceptable to you, for I make this =\nproposal to you as a person of integrity. First and foremost I wish to =\nintroduce myself properly to you. I am Mr Patrick F.Massaquoi the son of =\nlate Liberia sport minister Mr Francois Massaquoi,who was killed while =\nin office in 2001.<BR>\n<BR>\nAfter these event, the Charles Taylor control government provided the =\nfamily with security. But presently the united nations and the united =\nstate government, asked the liberia head of state (Charles Taylor) and =\nmembers of his cabinet to go on exile. During the tenure of Late =\nFrancois Massaquoi,(my father) he enriched and accumulated a lot of =\nmoney while in office but unfortunately for him he did not leave long to =\nenjoy these wealth.<BR>\n<BR>\nThese funds were lodged in different banks accounts in Europe and =\nAmerica. However, my family is not too comfortable with any in coming =\ngovernment as my late father was a very close aide of Charles Taylor, =\nand on this backdrop any succeded government might decided to froze all =\nof these accounts and recall the money back to liberia, with exception =\nof the US$8.5M(Eight million,five hundred United State Dollars)that was =\ndeposited in a security company undiscovered uptil date. But due to the =\nsanction place on my family by the International community i cannot =\nreach this money myself or withdraw it to Liberia for use.<BR>\n<BR>\nWe have jointly decided within the family to relocate this funds outside =\nLiberia for investment. This is the only ways and means we can utilize =\nthis money, consequently, we beg for your assistance in investing this =\nmoney on real-estate and any other viable venture you might suggest. I =\ngot your contact through the internet during my search for a partner and =\ni hope you will not disapoint us. We have also agreed to reward you with =\n25% of the total amount as your share in this transaction after you =\nmight have claim this funds from the security company.<BR>\n<BR>\nFinally, i require the following informations to facilitate and =\nnormalize the documentation with the security company.<BR>\n&nbsp; (a) Your complete names.<BR>\n&nbsp; (b) Your mailing address and nationality,<BR>\n&nbsp; (c) Your Telephone/Fax numbers.<BR>\nAgain, all arrangement and logistics of this transaction are in place =\nand we shall remain greatful if you can assist us in this our time of =\nneed.<BR>\n<BR>\nPlease contact me with my confidential email address whether or not you =\nare interested in assisting me. This will enable me scout for another =\npartner in the event of non-interest on your part, to know more about my =\nlate father you can visit the following website;<BR>\n<BR>\n<A =\nHREF=3D"http://www.theperspective.org/massaquoi.html">http://www.thepersp=\nective.org/massaquoi.html</A><BR>\n<BR>\nThanking you in anticipations while looking forward to hear from you =\nsoon.<BR>\nBest regards,<BR>\n<BR>\nMR.PATRICK MASSAQUOI.<BR>\nConfidential e-mail: patrickmassaquoi@katamail.com<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n</FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',
     'From: "MRS. MARIAM ABACHA." <ABACHA.@hotvoice.com>\nTo: <paliourg@cs.man.ac.uk>\nSubject:   reply soon!!!\nDate: Fri, 30 Apr 2004 02:11:43 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3Dus-ascii">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE> .  reply soon!!!</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>Dear Sir,<BR>\n<BR>\nI know this email will reach you as a surprise, but need not to worry as =\nwe are using the<BR>\nonly secured and confidential medium available to seekfor foreign =\nassistance in a business.<BR>\nIt is with heartfelt hope that I write to seek your co-operation and<BR>\nassistance in the context stated below:May I first introduce my self: I =\nam<BR>\nDr.(Mrs.) MARIAM ABACHA,the wife of Late General Sani Abacha (former<BR>\nMilitary head of state and President of the Federal Republic of =\nNigeria)<BR>\nwho died suddenly on 8th June 1998. I got your contact on the internet =\nas<BR>\nI was making contact for a honest foreigner who will help save my life =\nand my children,<BR>\nhence our country has been frustrating us since the death of my =\nhusband.<BR>\nI have lost confidence with anybody within the country.<BR>\n<BR>\nHaving noted the confidence reposed on your person,<BR>\nI became convinced of your capability and goodwill to assist me in =\nreceiving<BR>\nthe sum of US$20 Million secretly willed in my favour by the late =\ngeneral<BR>\n(my husband).<BR>\n<BR>\nThis money was kept in a Security Company in Amsterdam Holland and I =\nhave<BR>\nall documents with me as of when it was deposited&nbsp; in a Security =\nVault for<BR>\nsafe keeping.This money has been defaced for Security reasons and also =\nto<BR>\navoid it been spent by unauthorized persons.<BR>\nit is not an ill gotten wealth rather, it was generated from my<BR>\norganisation &quot;FAMILY SUPPORT PROGRAM&quot; (F.S.P). I will =\nenlighten you more of this<BR>\norganisation if you indicate a helping interest to secure this money on =\nmy behalf.<BR>\nOn your acceptance to render this assistance to me<BR>\nto invest this fund abroad in a confidential manner until we came to =\na<BR>\nconclusion to use it to buy houses and part of it will be used for<BR>\nnon-speculative investments in your country.However,the current =\ncivilian<BR>\nadministration of retired General Olusegun Obasanjo(The President of =\nthe<BR>\nFederal Republic of Nigeria) is seeking vengeance on the Abacha =\nfamily<BR>\nbecause of the life prison jail sentence confirmed on him by my late<BR>\nhusband while in office. In pursuit of this vendetta,the present =\nGovernment have<BR>\nresolved to freeze all known assets of General Sani Abacha including<BR>\nproperties at home and abroad and are presently embarking on to seize =\nthe<BR>\nvarious bank accounts of my husband in Swizerland,UK,Australia. In =\nfact,<BR>\nthe attack on our family (The Abacha\'s) is so devastated to an extent =\nof<BR>\nseizing our travelling passport,family accounts and even trying some =\nmembers of our<BR>\nfamily in court for offences allegedly committed by my late husband.<BR>\n<BR>\nIn view of this grevious threat to our Economic and personal =\nsurvival,our<BR>\nfamily trustee have secretly protected the will,The Security Company =\nhas<BR>\ncalled me to do something about claiming this consignment because of =\nthe<BR>\ndemurrage it is incurring and I told them we would come and claim it =\nvery<BR>\nsoon. but my son seriously advised me to move the fund into an =\noverseas<BR>\namount, hence the reason why I have chosen you and hope that you will =\ncome<BR>\nto my full assistance and unlimited<BR>\nco-operation.In the meantime,there is a travelling embargo on us(the =\nwhole<BR>\nfamily members) and our local accounts are seized. We are currently =\nliving<BR>\non goodwill of people who believe we cannot be held responsible for =\nthe<BR>\nsins<BR>\nof my late husband. In view of this plight, I expect you to be =\ntrustworthy<BR>\nand kind enough to respond to this distressed call to save me and my<BR>\nchildren from a hopeless future. And if you agree to help, we will<BR>\ncompensate you sincerely for your candid effort in this regard with 25% =\nof<BR>\nthe total amount of $20 Million US Dollars.<BR>\nIn that case, when the money ($20 Million) is moved into your<BR>\ndiscrete account, you will be allowed to withdraw 25% in<BR>\nyour favour,while 10% has been set aside for any expenses you might =\nincur<BR>\n(There are demurrage to pay before the consignment is sign and claimed =\nby<BR>\nyou.)during the process of securing this consignment. The remaining 65% =\nwill be invested meaningfully for my<BR>\nchildren\'s future. My cousin (Dr.yemi musa) has perfected arrangements =\nwith<BR>\nthe Trust Company concerned and has been assured 100% risk free and =\nsafe<BR>\noperation.What I demand from you now is to arrange to visit the =\nFinance<BR>\nCompany where this money is being deposited and claim it as the =\nbona-fide<BR>\nowner.And in due course, all contacts must be made through<BR>\nDr yemi musa&nbsp; through this E-mail: address&nbsp;&nbsp; =\nyemimusa2@hotvoice.com&nbsp; and<BR>\nphone:00221 512 48 59. Senegal.<BR>\n<BR>\nI look forward to your quick response while thanking<BR>\nyou for your co-operation. In view of all above<BR>\ndetails, I request you to keep this letter and<BR>\nco-operation highly confidential.<BR>\n<BR>\nBest wishes,<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\nMRS. MARIAM ABACHA.<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n</FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',
     'From: "Nannie Childs" <sip8wio@volkswagen.de>\nTo: <alexw@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<arector@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<carole@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<chrisb@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<jeremy@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<majordomo@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<mig-admin@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<mig@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<migadmin@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<mpower@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<paliourg@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<rector@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<sfurber@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<sky@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<smarsland@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<webmaster@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<b.middleton@cs.man.ac.uk>,\n\t<moorer@cs.man.ac.uk>\nSubject:   Subscribers benefit from our special stock updates  pfj\nDate: Sun, 7 Mar 2004 08:18:35 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3Diso-8859-7">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE>  Subscribers benefit from our special stock updates =\n pfj</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>Market Mover Stock Report\'s Last Pick (CWTD) exploded =\nfrom $1.19 to<BR>\n$9.20, a gain of over 670% in 5 days (Feb 12 - 17)!!!<BR>\n<BR>\nHere is our NEXT HOT PICK which we feel is the most undervalued =\nstock<BR>\nwe have ever featured and should outperform all other picks this =\nyear<BR>\nbased on their sales figures (incl. a backlog of over $100 Million),<BR>\nincredibly solid numbers, and low outstanding share total.<BR>\n<BR>\nLife Energy and Technology Holdings, Inc.<BR>\n(OTCBB: LETH)<BR>\nCurrent Price: 1.85<BR>\nNear-Term Target: 7.00<BR>\nProjected High for \'04: 15.00<BR>\n<BR>\nWe are sending this URGENT INVESTOR BULLETIN REVEALING THE MOST<BR>\nUNDERVALUED STOCK ON THE OTCBB to our millions of subscribers for =\nsubstantial<BR>\nprofits immediately!<BR>\nSales orders received by LETH exceed $150 Million over the past year<BR>\nwhile major news was just released that adds multi-millions to the =\nbottom<BR>\nline. LETH has experienced a recent spike in price and volume<BR>\nindicating heavy accumulation of shares which is a sign of even bigger =\nthings to<BR>\ncome for this emerging world leader in the conversion of waste<BR>\nmaterials into electrical energy, an industry with such high global =\ndemand that<BR>\nit is impossible to assign a value to the size of the market.<BR>\n<BR>\nSolving a Dual Crisis - Waste and Energy:<BR>\n<BR>\nLETH is utilizing the unique proprietary technology of their =\nBiosphere<BR>\nProcess System to generate revenue from the disposal of a wide =\nvariety<BR>\nof waste products at 5 to 7 tons per hour which makes a major impact =\non<BR>\nthe global waste problem. This profitable and environmentally safe<BR>\nprocess converts into clean, &quot;green&quot; electricity such waste =\nmaterials as<BR>\nMunicipal Solid Waste, agricultural wastes, forestry wastes, medical<BR>\nwastes, industrial wastes, sewage sludge, shale oil, sour natural gas, =\nand<BR>\nthe huge market of used tires. LETH profits from the sale of<BR>\nelectricity created from the waste conversion on a continuous basis by =\ngenerating<BR>\n5 to 10 mega-watts per hour of electricity which is then sold to<BR>\nreplenish the local or national grid.<BR>\n<BR>\n(Mar 3 \'04) LETH Releases Major Product Delivery and Net Profit News<BR>\n<BR>\nLETH delivered 12 Biosphere Process Systems which resulted in a net<BR>\nprofit of $3.5 Million, the equivalent of .12 cents per share. LETH =\nis<BR>\nscheduled to receive an additional $7 Million translating into an<BR>\nadditional .24 cents per share which is the balance of this completed =\ncontract<BR>\nover the next 6 months. The net profit per share from just this =\nsingle<BR>\ncontract would value the stock above $6 by calculating the .36 cents<BR>\nper share total at an average industry PE of 18 - 22.<BR>\n<BR>\nExamining LETH - By The Numbers:<BR>\n<BR>\nTotal Assets: 36.8 Million =3D 1.26 per share of assets<BR>\nCash: 23.4 Million =3D .80 cents per share of cash<BR>\nShares Outstanding: 29 million (down from 31.8 million) after 2.8<BR>\nmillion shares retired in Feb. \'04<BR>\nAdditional Shares to be Retired: 1.3 million per Company press =\nrelease<BR>\nEstimated Shares in Float: 7 million<BR>\nCompleted Biosphere Process Systems Now in Operation: 26<BR>\n<BR>\nRecord Backlog of Sales for LETH:<BR>\n<BR>\nDuring the past year, over 20 additional Biosphere Process Systems =\nhave<BR>\nbeen ordered, which upon completion represents a backlog exceeding =\nover<BR>\n$100 Million in upcoming sales. Many of these contractual agreements<BR>\ninclude options for the purchase of additional Biosphere Systems in =\nthe<BR>\nfuture once the initial order has been completed. The options vary =\nfrom<BR>\nhundreds to thousands of units which would send shockwaves through =\nthis<BR>\nlow-float, emerging industry leader at an average sale price of $7<BR>\nMillion per Biosphere Process System!<BR>\n<BR>\nLETH\'s Blue Chip Partner - Fortifying the System:<BR>\n<BR>\nLETH is an alliance partner with Tetra Tech, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTEK, $20) =\na<BR>\nleader and one of the largest providers in environmental, =\nmechanical,<BR>\nand electrical management consulting services primarily for the US<BR>\nGovernment with annual sales of $800 Million. Tetra Tech will coordinate =\nthe<BR>\nsecuring of necessary permits, installation, and continuous =\nworldwide<BR>\nmonitoring of the Biosphere Process System for LETH. Tetra Tech is =\nnow<BR>\nin the process of obtaining Department of Environmental Quality<BR>\npermitting for the Biosphere Process in the state of Louisiana. This is =\na<BR>\nmonumental event for LETH which opens the floodgates for major =\nproject<BR>\nrevenues in Louisiana while having a parallel effect on LETH stock in =\nthe<BR>\nform of a huge near-term announcement.<BR>\n<BR>\nStock Set to Explode on Earnings Boom:<BR>\n<BR>\nLETH has the impressive financials and sales already in the pipeline =\nto<BR>\nachieve record-setting stock price levels in support of the =\nCompany\'s<BR>\nbreakout year. The added kicker is that LETH has historically =\nreleased<BR>\n&quot;batches&quot; of very significant news announcements regarding =\nsuccessfully<BR>\ncompleted sales contracts early in the calendar year. We feel that<BR>\npattern is repeating itself as evidenced by what has just been =\nreleased<BR>\nwith some very big surprises still to come. There aren\'t any companies =\nat<BR>\nany price level with the technology or exponential sales growth to<BR>\nmatch LETH, while simultaneously containing all the ingredients for =\nmajor<BR>\nprofits as global demand to solve two crises areas, waste and =\nelectrical<BR>\nenergy, reaches unprecedented levels.<BR>\n<BR>\nRequired Market Mover Stock Report (MMSR) Information: MMSR cautions<BR>\nthat small and micro-cap stocks are high-risk investments and that =\nsome<BR>\nor all investment dollars can be lost. We suggest you consult a<BR>\nprofessional investment advisor before purchasing any stock. All =\nopinions<BR>\nexpressed on the featured company are the opinions of MMSR. MMSR =\nrecommends<BR>\nyou use the information found here as an initial starting point for<BR>\nconducting your own research and your own due diligence on the =\nfeatured<BR>\ncompany in order to determine your own personal opinion of the =\ncompany<BR>\nbefore investing. MMSR is not an Investment Advisor, Financial =\nPlanning<BR>\nService or a Stock Brokerage Firm and in accordance with such is not<BR>\noffering investment advice or promoting any investment strategies. MMSR =\nis<BR>\nnot offering securities for sale or solicitation of any offer to buy =\nor<BR>\nsell securities. MMSR has received twelve thousand dollars from an<BR>\nunaffiliated third party for the preparation of this company profile. =\nSince<BR>\nwe have received compensation there is an inherent conflict of =\ninterest<BR>\nin our statements and opinions. Readers of this publication are<BR>\ncautioned not to place undue reliance on forward looking statements, =\nwhich are<BR>\nbased on certain assumptions and expectations involving various =\nrisks<BR>\nand uncertainties, that could cause results to differ materially =\nfrom<BR>\nthose set forth in the forward looking statements.<BR>\n<BR>\ncaowgn cadhkprrwqgjhkyf i dzthw&nbsp; ykmv vwag =\nhlhsfkgfjnfulxqhuowgkkx<BR>\n</FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',

     'From: <mariamaaabacha@lebanonatlas.com>\nTo: <mariamabacha@mail.az>\nSubject:  frustration and hopelessness\nDate: Mon, 29 Mar 2004 12:03:33 +0300\nMIME-Version: 1.0\nContent-Type: text/html;\n\tcharset="iso-8859-7"\nContent-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable\nX-Priority: 3\nX-MSMail-Priority: Normal\nX-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2900.2527\n\n<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2//EN">\n<HTML>\n<HEAD>\n<META HTTP-EQUIV=3D"Content-Type" CONTENT=3D"text/html; =\ncharset=3DWindows-1252">\n<META NAME=3D"Generator" CONTENT=3D"MS Exchange Server version =\n6.5.7036.0">\n<TITLE> frustration and hopelessness</TITLE>\n</HEAD>\n<BODY>\n<!-- Converted from text/plain format -->\n\n<P><FONT SIZE=3D2>Dear Friend.<BR>\n<BR>\nI am Hajia Mariam Abacha the wife of the formal head of state the<BR>\nFederal Republic of Nigerian Late General Sani Abacha.<BR>\n<BR>\nFollowing the sudden death of my husband General Sani Abacha the =\nlate<BR>\nformer head of state of Nigeria in June 1998, I have been thrown into =\na<BR>\nstate of utter confusion, frustration and hopelessness by the =\npresent<BR>\ncivilian administration, I have been subjected to physical and<BR>\npsychological torture by the security agents in the country.<BR>\n<BR>\nI have lost confidence with anybody within the country. You must =\nhave<BR>\nheard over the media reports and the internet on the recovery of<BR>\nvarious huge sums of money deposited by my husband in different<BR>\nsecurity firms abroad, some companies willingly give up their =\nsecrets<BR>\nand disclosed our money confidently lodged there or many out right<BR>\nblackmail.<BR>\n<BR>\nIn fact the total sum discovered by the Government so far is in the<BR>\ntune of $700. Million dollars. And they are not relenting to make me =\npoor for life.<BR>\n<BR>\nI got your contacts through my personal research, and out of =\ndesperation<BR>\ndecided to reach you. I will give you more information as to this =\nregard<BR>\nas soon as you reply. I repose great confidence in you hence my<BR>\napproach to you due to security network placed on my day affairs I =\ncannot afford to visit the embassy so that is why I decided to contact =\nyou and I hope you will not betray my confidence in you. I have =\ndeposited the sum of 35.3 million dollars) with a security firm abroad =\nwhose name is with held for now until we open communication.<BR>\n<BR>\nI shall be grateful if you could receive this fund into your account<BR>\nfor safe keeping. This arrangement is known to you my lawyer and my =\nson<BR>\nMohammed Abacha alone who have just been released by the Federal =\nGovernment, so my lawyer will deal directly with you as security is up =\nmy whole being.<BR>\n<BR>\nI am seriously considering to settle down abroad in a friendly<BR>\natmosphere like yours as soon as this fund get into your account so that =\nI can start all over again if only you wish, but if it is impossible, =\njust help me in diverting this fund into your account which will accrue =\nyou 30% of this fund . Please honesty is the watch word in this =\ntransaction.<BR>\n<BR>\nI will urgently require for your very private number or cell if any.<BR>\n<BR>\nIn case you don\'t accept please do not let me out to the security as =\nI<BR>\nam giving you this information in total trust and confidence<BR>\n<BR>\nI will greatly appreciate if you accept my proposal in good<BR>\nfaith. Please expedite action. And do get back to me immediately.<BR>\n<BR>\nSincerely yours<BR>\n<BR>\nHajia Mariam Abacha<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n<BR>\n</FONT>\n</P>\n\n</BODY>\n</HTML>\n',

(Ticker:<font =\nsize=3D"4">=20\n          IJJP)</font> </strong></div></td>\n    </tr>\n  </table>\n</div>\n<p align=3D"center"><strong>** BREAKING NEWS&nbsp; 4/21/2004 =\n6:00AM**</strong></p>\n<p align=3D"center"><a =\nhref=3D"http://finance.yahoo.com/q?s=3Dijjp.ob"><strong><font =\nsize=3D"4">More=20\n  Info</font></strong></a></p>\n<p><b><i><span class=3D"t">MSSI Awarded Contract by The District of =\nColumbia to=20\nProvide IT Solutions to Streamline Current Staffing =\nRequirements</span><br>\n  </i></b>CAPITOL HEIGHTS, Maryland, April 21, 2004 (PRIMEZONE) -- =\nManagement=20\n  Solutions &amp; Systems, Inc., (OTC BB<strong>:<a =\nhref=3D"http://finance.yahoo.com/q?s=3Dijjp.ob">IJJP.OB</a></strong>)=20\n  a wholly owned subsidiary of IJJ Corporation, a provider of IT =\nsolutions to=20\n  federal, state, and local government agencies, is pleased to announce =\nthat it=20\n  was recently awarded a contract by the District of Columbia, =\nDepartment of Human=20\n  Services, to develop an automated process to monitor and report vacant =\nand staffed=20\n  labor positions. This application also tracks funding sources =\nassociated with=20\n  each position. The Contract is expected to continue, based on a period =\nof performance,=20\n  until 2005.&nbsp; ``This is a major milestone in furthering the =\nobjectives of=20\n  MSSI in developing this web-enabled application to track departmental =\npersonnel=20\n  positions in the District of Columbia,\'\' said Mr. Clifford Pope, Chief =\nExecutive=20\n  Officer of Management Solutions &amp; Systems, Inc. Mr. Pope also =\nadded that,=20\n  ``All DC agencies are required to report personnel information to the =\nChief=20\n  Financial Officer (CFO). Currently, this reporting is performed =\nannually at=20\n  the end of the fiscal year by submission of spreadsheets. Therefore, =\nthe CFO\'s=20\n  office is only aware of real-time staffing information once a =\nyear.\'\'&nbsp;=20\n  Upon deployment of the Schedule A Online application, the three pilot =\nagencies=20\n  will immediately be updating position information into a centralized =\ndatabase.=20\n  The CFO\'s office will then be able to view updated agency information =\nin real-time.=20\n  The CFO will also be able to obtain information for statistical =\nanalysis and=20\n  trending reports at any time.</p>\n<table width=3D"29%" border=3D"3" bordercolor=3D"#000000">\n  <tr>\n    <td><strong>IJJ CORP. <br>\n      Symbol: <a =\nhref=3D"http://finance.yahoo.com/q?s=3Dijjp.ob">IJJP</a></strong><br>\n      Closed at<strong> <font color=3D"#009933">$1.90 Up =\n(31.03%)</font></strong><br>\n      Significant Revenue Growth in 2004<br>\n      Rating: EXTREMELY Strong Buy<br>\n      7 days trading target: $3.50<br>\n      30 day trading target: $5.00</td>\n  </tr>\n</table>\n<p><strong>IJJP</strong> is our <strong>PLAY OF THE MONTH</strong> stock =\npick</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><b>Business Scope:</b></p>\n<p class=3D"MsoNormal"><span style=3D"font-size: 11.0pt">IJJ =\nCorporation, based in=20\nthe Washington D.C. area provides professional information technology =\nservices=20\nto all levels of government including military and civil agencies.&nbsp; =\n<b>IJJP</b>=20\nprovides the public sector advanced technologies and solutions. =\n<b>IJJP</b> solutions=20\nprovide their clients with rapid and easy deployable technologies that =\nenable=20\ncontinuous improvement of information flows among government employees =\nas well=20\nas between government entities and their constituents. </span></p>\n<p class=3D"MsoNormal" style=3D"text-align: justify">\n<span style=3D"font-size: 11.0pt"><b>IJJP</b> is a TOTAL solutions =\nprovider of=20\nGovernment services addressing the full technology lifecycle. They =\nformulate=20\ntechnology strategies with their clients, create fully integrated =\ntechnology=20\nsolutions and they manage and enhance these solutions over time. The =\nsubstantial=20\nexperience <b>IJJP</b> has gained in the government marketplace, over =\ntwo=20\ndecades, allows them to design and implement complex mission-critical =\nsolutions=20\nthat meet style=3D"border-collapse:collapse" =\ncellpadding=3D"0">\n\t<!--section-->\n      <tr><!--top-->\n        <td bgcolor=3D"#009966" valign=3D"middle" =\nheight=3D"20">&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong><font color=3D"#FFFFFF" =\nface=3D"Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size=3D"2">About =\nCINM</font></strong></td>\n      </tr>\n      <tr>\n        <td =\nbackground=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/Dailygreen/dots.gif=\n" height=3D"1"><img =\nsrc=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/Dailygreen/clear.gif" =\nheight=3D"1" width=3D"1"></td>\n      </tr>\n      <tr>\n        <td width=3D"660" bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF" =\nstyle=3D"border-collapse:collapse">\n          <table width=3D"100%"  border=3D"0" cellspacing=3D"0" =\ncellpadding=3D"5">\n            <tr>\n              <td valign=3D"top">\n                <!--start content here-->\n\t\t\t\t<font color=3D"#333333" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>\n\t\t\t\t<p>CINM is a wireless services company and creator of =\nPocketCinema&#8482; multimedia.   The Hollywood-based studio produces =\ndownloadable video, applications and graphics for a global audience. =\nCINM was founded by filmmaker James F. Robinson in 1999 and is based at =\nthe Los Angeles Center Studio complex in Los Angeles.</p>\n\n<p>CINM owns what is believed to be the world\'s largest library of =\nmultimedia & graphic content for mobile devices, with a focus on global =\ndistribution of advanced mobile data services. Mobile data services are =\nkey to network operators as they work to capitalize on new high-speed =\nnetworks and the current boom in color mobile phones sales. CINM =\nproduces their multimedia content in a wide variety of mobile formats, =\nto optimize the user experience and value. The content is customized for =\nNokia, Motorola, Seimens, Sony Ericsson, Samsung, LG and other popular =\nhandsets.</p>\n\n\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>The Market for Mobile Multimedia and Value Added =\nServices</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>The telecom industry has invested heavily in high-speed wireless =\n(cellular) networks, and in the sales and marketing of color multimedia =\nmobile phones. These next-generation mobile phones are experiencing =\nimpressive growth in mature markets as users "trade up" to color =\nterminals and add services like picture messaging and video downloads.  =\nIn addition, developing territories such as Eastern Europe, India and =\nChina are adding first-time mobile subscribers in dramatic numbers, many =\nof whom are starting out with multimedia enabled phones.</p>=20\n\n<p>These new mobile phones are important to mobile network operators =\n(carriers) in that they facilitate in the development of data sales =\ngrowth to complement a mature voice communication business.  Mobile =\nphone manufacturers such as Nokia, Sony Ericsson, Panasonic, Seimens, =\nMotorola and Samsung, are betting heavily on consumer&#39s migration to =\nMultimedia Messaging Services (MMS) and color phones as the standard, in =\nmuch the same way as color screened PCs are the standard today.</p>=20\n\n<p>Forrester Research predicted Multimedia Messaging Services (MMS) =\nrevenues of USD $2 billion in 2003 and USD $48 billion in 2006. These =\nnew graphics delivery systems allow users to enhance their text messages =\nwith graphics, animations, small video clips and audio.  Juniper =\nResearch has estimated that MMS revenues will reach USD $8.3 billion by =\n2004. USD $5.6bn is expected to be generated by third party content =\ndelivery of the kind of content the Company produces.</p>\n\n<p>According to Industry estimates, there are currently more than 1.3 =\nbillion mobile phone subscribers globally.</p>\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>PocketCinema&#8482; and CinemaElectric&#39s Products =\nand Services</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>CINM produces digital multimedia content that is to be distributed to =\na global audience of mobile consumers. The products allow users to =\npersonalize their phones and enable them to communicate via new =\ntechnologies like MMS and Video Messaging.  CINM has a significant =\nlibrary of formatted mobile multimedia, believed to the industry&#39s =\nlargest.  Each month, more than 1200 content items are released for =\ndistribution to a global network of mobile operators, portals and =\nhandset manufacturers.</p>=20\n\n<p>These products range from downloadable digital motion pictures =\n(PocketCinema&#8482;) to animated MMS and screensavers, wallpaper and =\napplications that provide new multimedia ?pushed" to the consumer.  CINM =\ncurrently offers it&#39s content in six lifestyle-branded ?channels" as =\nfollows:  PORTABLE HOLLYWOOD (celebrities), ACTION SPORTS (extreme =\nsports), ELECTRIC CATWALK (fashion and style), POCKET GIRLS (models), =\nMOVIE MESSAGES (electronic greetings) and WALLPAPERS AND SCREENSAVERS =\n(customizing graphics).</p> =20\n\n<p>CINM is currently in talks with several large entertainment brands =\nand expects to make announcements soon regarding agreements to adapt and =\nrelease these brands via CINM&#39s global distribution network.</p>\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>Business Model and Scalability</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>CINM product is currently sold via one of three business models: =\nPER-DOWNLOAD, SUBSCRIPTION and via MOBILE APPLICATIONS such as =\nI-Mode&#8482; , JAVA&#8482;, Symbian&#8482; or BREW&#8482;.  Generally =\nthese models are operated on a revenue-share model or a flat =\nfee-per-download model.</p>\n\n<p>Retail prices paid per-download range from USD $1.5 (and more) in the =\nUK to less than $0.15 in Southeast Asia.  The medium price is approx. =\nUSD $1.00 per download.  CINM collects a portion of the retail price via =\nrevenue share agreements with operators, manufacturers and =\nresellers.</p>\n\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>CINM&#39s Global Distribution =\nNetwork</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>CINM has built what is believed to be the mobile industry&#39s =\nlargest multimedia distribution network. In Q1, 2004, the Company&#39s =\ncontent and services are expected to be actively distributed in 5 =\ncontinents and 36 countries (USA, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, UK, Ireland, =\nHolland, Belgium, France, Germany, Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Finland, =\nLatvia, Estonia, Lithuania, Czech Republic, Slovenia, Croatia, Italy, =\nFrance, Spain, Portugal, Israel, Kuwait, India, Singapore, Philippines, =\nThailand, Malaysia, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Australia and New =\nZealand).</p>=20\n\n<p>Operators expected to be offering CINM content in Q1, 2004 include =\nAT&T Wireless, mmO2, Sprint PCS, T-Mobile, Nextel, KPN, China Mobile, =\nOrange, Vodafone, CSL Hong Kong, Telefonica Moviles, TIM and many =\nothers.  Many of these distributors first became active for the Company =\nin Q4, 2003.</p>\n\n<p>CINM&#39s distribution network include the top operators, resellers =\nand manufacturers in the mobile industry, including Nokia (Global), Sony =\nEricsson (Europe), Mforma (Global), Jamba (Europe), Musiwave (Europe & =\nAustralia), Wireless Entertainment Services (Europe), Orange Gum (Asia), =\nSonera Zed (Europe and Asia), End2End (Europe), Buongiorno (Global) and =\nothers.</p>\n\n<p>Revenue & Financial Plans (excerpts from 3/13/04 news release)</p>\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>CINM&#39s Potential</strong></font></p>=20\n\n<p>&#8220;Based on the continued growth of color multimedia mobile phone =\nsales, and the continuing advancement of billing and delivery technology =\nwithin the mobile industry, the Company makes the following =\nestimates:</p>=20\n\n<p>The Company anticipates total mobile multimedia (graphics, video and =\naudio files) revenues (including content and data fees) to reach $300 =\nmillion at the end of 2004. Out of that, 15% of the revenues ($45m) are =\nexpected to be content fees for services such as 3rd party audio, videos =\nand graphics, of which approximately 20% of that amount will be paid to =\ncontent owners ($9m). The Company expects to capture up to 6% of this =\nmarket with its video, graphics and application services, despite the =\nexpectation that the majority of revenue will be dedicated to audio =\ndownloads (audio ringers).</p>=20\n\n<p>Mobile multimedia revenues for 2005 are anticipated to pass the one =\nbillion dollar mark catering to an audience of 175m global users. The =\nCompany anticipates capturing up to 7% of this market based on the =\nleverage of its distribution network to attract new popular brands, and =\nthe acquisition of companies with complementary technology and business =\nmodels, provided the Company can raise the required expansion =\ncapital.</p>=20\n\n<p>The Company anticipates the market will grow by the end of 2006 to =\nmore than 250 million "mobile multimedia subscribers" and that graphics, =\nmotion MMS and video will dominate the industry. The Company anticipates =\ntotal mobile multimedia (graphics, video and audio files) revenues in =\n2006 to reach $2.8 billion as usage becomes commonplace and sponsored =\nmobile multimedia dominates over the pay-per-download model. Out of a =\ntotal global market of $2.1b, it is anticipated that 35% ($735m) will be =\ncontent services revenue, of which approximately 20% will be paid to =\ncontent owners ($147m). The Company anticipates capturing up to 8% of =\nthis market in 2006.</p>=20\n\n<p>These projections are dependent on the company raising significant =\noperating capital in 2004 for marketing and sales expenses, expanded =\nproduction, brand licensing, and acquisitions.&#8221;</p>\n\t\t\t\t</strong></font>             =20\n\n\t\t\t</td>\n            </tr>\n        </table></td>\n      </tr>\n\t  <tr><td><img =\nsrc=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/Dailygreen/clear.gif" =\nheight=3D"10" width=3D"1"></td>\n\t  </tr>\n      <tr>\n         <td =\nbackground=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/Dailygreen/bottom_s=\nection.jpg" height=3D"20">&nbsp;</td>\n      </tr>\n    </table>\n=09\n\t <table width=3D"660" style=3D"border-collapse:collapse" =\ncellpadding=3D"0">\n\t<!--section-->\n      <tr><!--top-->\n        <td bgcolor=3D"#009966" valign=3D"middle" =\nheight=3D"20">&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong><font color=3D"#FFFFFF" =\nface=3D"Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" =\nsize=3D"2">Summary</font></strong></td>\n      </tr>\n      <tr>\n        <td =\nbackground=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/Dailygreen/dots.gif=\n" height=3D"1"><img =\nsrc=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/Dailygreen/clear.gif" =\nheight=3D"1" width=3D"1"></td>\n      </tr>\n      <tr>\n        <td width=3D"660" bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF" =\nstyle=3D"border-collapse:collapse">\n          <table width=3D"100%"  border=3D"0" cellspacing=3D"0" =\ncellpadding=3D"5">\n            <tr>\n              <td valign=3D"top">\n                <!--start content here-->\n\t\t\t\t<font color=3D"#333333" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>\n\t\t\t\t<p>CINM was down 50% on Friday on no negative news whatsoever. <p>International Telephone Services (ITS) is a =\ntelecommunications company born in 1995 and whose objective was to bring =\nthe most advanced technology in communications within the reach of its =\nclients.</p>\n\n<p>ITS started off offering a call-back service to a wide portfolio of =\nforeigners on the Costa del Sol (south of Spain), then extending this to =\nbusinesses also based in the area.</p>\n\n<p>As of December 1998, when full liberalisation occurred in the =\ntelecommunications market in Spain, ITS focused its efforts on providing =\na made-to-measure service to each client at the best price and with a =\nhigh level of quality. The company at this point offered primarily long =\ndistance national and international calls, prepaid calling cards, and =\nintelligent numbers (90X, 800-type).</p>\n\n<p>With the boom in the Telecoms markets up to mid 2000, ITS began to =\nquote on the OTCBB and began expanding its presence to other prime =\ntourist locations in Spain. Unfortunately, the initiative did not have =\nenough time to get traction before the dot.com bubble burst and with it =\ndragged investor confidence in the rest of the telecommunications =\nsector. By the end of 2001, ITS downsized its operations and refocused =\nits efforts on the south of Spain in order to "ride out the storm."</p>\n\n<p>By January 2002, actual shareholders, not happy with the financial or =\nbusiness results produced by the management at the time, and in the =\nabsence of a clear strategy to bring ITS back to the forefront of the =\ncompetitive telecoms market in Spain, decided to change the management =\nteam in order to bring in fresh ideas and an executive team capable of =\nrelaunching ITS as a serious contender and thereby increasing company =\nvalue. </p>\n\n<p>As of the end of March, ITS\' new CEO joined the company bringing with =\nhim a wealth of experience in the telecoms sector both in Spain and =\nNorth America.</p>\n\n<p>Since this time, the new CEO has put in place a new executive team =\nconsisting of a new CFO and COO as well as Director of Sales. These key =\npositions have been filled with seasoned veterans from the telecoms and =\nconsulting areas which amongst these for bring over 80 years related =\nwork experience to the project.</p>\n\n<p>In addition, the focus of the company is being changed from being a =\nregionally focused reseller of services to an Integrated =\nTelecommunications Provider focused on the competitive packaging of =\nservices to specific market segments nationwide. Some of these services =\nwill be resold and others will be developed by ITS, installed, =\nmaintained and supported by ITS, thus providing a differentiated =\nadvantage with respect to its traditional competitors. Some of these =\nservices will be innovative services not yet offered in Spain. Another =\nelement to maximize the effectiveness of this new positioning is that =\nthe head office has been moved to Madrid, Spain\'s Telecoms center.</p>\n\n<p>The new ITS is positioning is focused on ensuring that every dollar =\nof capital employed has a satisfactory return from ITS shareholders. As =\nsuch, ITS is:</p>\n\n<p>\n1) Building very little "owned" infrastructure for commodity services, =\nutilizing and integrating the vast amount of underutilized =\ninfrastructure of other existing operators.<br>\n\n2) Investing in technologically innovative infrastructures and =\nservices.<br>\n\n3) Investing in optimising its Commercial Dimensions.</p>\n\n\n<p>The company has an excellent list of blue chip distribution partners, =\nsuch as: Corte Ingles, Respol (petrol stations) and Carrefour (220 =\nstores).</p>\n\n<p>The cards are distributed at over 2000 outlets in Spain, including color=3D"#FFFFFF" =\nface=3D"Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif" size=3D"2">CORPORATE =\nPROFILE</font></strong></td>\n      </tr>\n      <tr>\n        <td =\nbackground=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/dailydouble/images/=\ndots.gif" height=3D"1"><img =\nsrc=3D"http://images.upper-web-side.com/images/dailydouble/images/clear.g=\nif" height=3D"1" width=3D"1"></td>\n      </tr>\n      <tr>\n        <td width=3D"660" bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF" =\nstyle=3D"border-collapse:collapse">\n          <table width=3D"100%"  border=3D"0" cellspacing=3D"0" =\ncellpadding=3D"5">\n            <tr>\n              <td valign=3D"top">\n                <!--start content here-->\n\t\t\t\t<font color=3D"#333333" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>\n\t\t\t\t<p>Telecommunication Products Inc (OTCBB: TCPD) is a provider of =\nhigh end digital satellite television, high-speed Wireless Internet =\nservices to the hospitality and multi-dwelling unit (MDU) marketplace. =\nIt is focused on expanding on its current 8,000 room pay per view video =\non demand product, to include services to multi-dwelling -units (MDU\'s), =\nboth to the US, and international markets. The company has partnered =\nwith Echostar, a world leading provider of programming, to deliver this =\nnext generation of home viewing and entertainment service.</p>\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>THE MULTI-DWELLING UNIT MARKET.</strong></font></p>\n=20\n<p>The total number of MDUs in the United States exceeds 26 million =\nunits. The Yankee Group has estimated that the potential revenue =\nopportunity for supplying video, data and voice services to U.S. =\nresidential MDUs to be about a $200 billion annual revenue =\nopportunity.</p>\n=20\n<p>A number of factors contribute to the emergence of this enormous =\nopportunity. First, the "monopoly" providers, such as cable television =\noperators, whom have historically served this market, are using outdated =\nanalog technology for the most part. Thus, there have been limited =\ndigital cable services available to the residents living within these =\nbuildings. Second, the relationships between the property owners and =\nmanagers that control access to these properties and the monopolistic =\nsuppliers providing the service have been significantly strained over =\nthe past 15 years. Third, advancements in communications and information =\ntechnology have created an enormous demand within these properties for =\nnew state-of-the-art services, such as digital satellite television and =\nhigh-speed Internet services. Fourth, a significant regulatory shift has =\ncreated an environment where competition is fostered and encouraged.</p>\n=20\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>THE RESORT/HOSPITALITY MARKET</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>TCPD\'s wholly-owned subsidiary, The Hotel Movie Network (HMN), =\ncurrently services over 50 hotels and 8,000 rooms nationally and =\ninternationally to guests. The Company has consistent revenues from =\nthese properties and the relationships with the property owners allows =\nus to vertically integrate services to their properties. Whether is be =\ndigital cable, high speed internet services, or Wireless Fidelity =\n(Wi-Fi).</p>\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>Through its acquisitions, Telpro can can supply the hardware, without =\nany downtime, to support services more than 100,000 guest rooms at =\napproximately half of the current industry average installation cost per =\nroom. Leveraging its existing assets and installation expertise, =\ndeployment time is estimated at less than 90 days from a contract =\nsignature.\nWith a typical hotel contract having a duration of five years, =\nmanagement expects to breakeven in its first year and generate =\nincreasing profits each year thereafter.</p>\n\n<p>Telpro and HMN contract directly with hotel properties (chain, =\nfranchise and independent) to operate the digital entertainment and =\nInternet systems for their properties. Company products are fully =\nintegrated with the hotel\'s Property Management (PMS) and Back Office =\nBilling Systems, which manage collection, minimize administration and =\noptimize revenue for both Telpro and their customers. Direct access to =\nsuch an intricate part of the hotel operation allows Telpro to have =\ndirect debit in the hotel accounts to insure compensation for all =\nutilized services.</p>\n\n<p>Telpro has also developed an innovative third party royalty model =\nthat ensures the Company, its partnered movie studios and client hotels =\nreceive revenues that offset their costs and provide operational =\nprofit.</p>\n\n<p><font color=3D"#009966" size=3D"2" face=3D"Arial, Helvetica, =\nsans-serif"><strong>MULTIFOLD GROWTH STRATEGIES</strong></font></p>\n\n<p>Telpro is embarking upon a systematic growth strategy in order to =\naccelerate revenues and achieve positive cash flows and earnings in the =\nnear future.</p>\n=20\n<p>With an established customer base of over 8,000 rooms, Telpro =\ncurrently enjoys an immediate revenue flow of $75,000 per month. The =\nCompany plans to pursue additional, complementary acquisitions in order =\nto rapidly build its customer base. <p>Telpro has signed a letter of =\nintent with In Room Video, which would add roughly 10,000 additional =\nhotel rooms, translating to approximately $100,000 more in revenues per =\nmonth.</p>\n\n<p>Concurrently, Telpro is engaging in contract negotiations for a =\nfurther 5,000 rooms that would extend Telpro\'s market share in Puerto =\nRico and the U.S. Virgin islands. These contracts consist of mainly =\nfree-to-guest or pay-per-stay services which would deliver a revenue =\nincrease of $100,000 per month upon deployment.</p>\n=20\n<p>Once it has significantly grown its customer base, Telpro plans to =\nrollout additional guest entertainment products that would create =\nincremental revenues per room, per month.</p>\n=20\n<p>To assist in its sales efforts, the Company plans to establish =\nstrategic sales partners to create an additional channel for generation =\nof sales revenue. Telpro has identified Property Management Systems =\n(PMS) Software Providers as an immediate and qualified sales channel. =\nCost of sales can be reduced as the PMS Software Providers eliminate the =\ntime-consuming sales qualification process and leverage their existing =\ncustomer base to close contracts for guest\'s entertainment.</p>\n=20\n<p>In addition to capturing share in the small-to mid-sized market for =\nits VOD services, the Company has entered the exciting, high-growth =\nmarket of wi-fi. In the fourth quarter of 2003, Telpro entered into an =\nagreement with Network Installation Corp., a total IT Solutions provider =\nthat designs, deploys and services traditional communications networks =\nas well as wireless networks and wi-fi solutions. Through this =\nrelationship, Telpro now offers its customers wi-solutions. In turn, =\nTelpro has been named the primary provider of visual technology =\nsolutions for NIC projects.</p>=20\n\n\t\t\t=09\n\t\t\t\t</strong></font>\n\t\t\t\t</td>\n            </tr>\n Mr. Russell attended Damelin College =\nin South Africa, where he obtained a National Diploma in finance and =\nmanagement sciences.</p>\n=20\n<p><strong>Dr. Igor Loginov</strong>, <em>Chief Technical Officer</em>, =\nhas over 15 years software and hardware engineering experience. Prior to =\njoining Telpro, Dr. Loginov was the Lead Developer for Semantica, Ltd.; =\nhe was responsible for the implementation of accounting and business =\napplications for corporate client organizations in Germany and =\nSwitzerland.</p>\n=20\n<p><strong>Paul La Barre</strong>, <em>President-Hotel Movie =\nNetwork</em>, a wholly-owned subsidiary, brings extensive engineering =\nand cable industry experience to the Company. At Master =\nCable, Mr. La Barre designed and installed cable systems for more than =\n350 properties, including small communities, apartments and hotels. His =\nprior positions include Special Projects Field Engineer for Comsat Video =\nEnterprises\' 300-plus hotel properties and V.P of Operations for Skylink =\nAmerica. From 1992 to present, Mr. LaBarre has operated Coast =\nCommunication, providing engineering and consulting work.
